DOC.brief_summary: The National Heart , Lung , Blood Institute ( NHLBI ) National Institute Health ( NIH ) sponsor consortium four site across United States , entitle Childhood Obesity Prevention Treatment Research ( COPTR ) . Each site protocol . Case Western Reserve/Cleveland 's project entitle `` Targeting Obesity Blood Pressure Urban Youth '' . The site name IMPACT ( Ideas Moving Parents Adolescents Change Together ) . The project assess effect three intervention Body Mass Index ( BMI ) overweight obese urban 5th-8th grade youth : cognitive-behavioral intervention ( HealthyChange ) , system improvement intervention ( SystemsChange ) , education-only intervention ( Tools4Change ) . In addition study assess potential additional impact school-community base intervention outcome . The project two phase : formative phase ( include focus group pilot ) main trial . The main trial take place approximately four year .

DOC.detailed_description: The IMPACT trial involve 3-arm randomize control trial three behavioral educational intervention : ( 1 ) HealthyCHANGE , behavioral approach focus building skill increase intrinsic motivation ( base cognitive-behavioral theory motivational interviewing component ) ; ( 2 ) SystemCHANGE , innovative behavioral approach focus system re-design family environment daily routine ( base social-ecological personal process improvement theory ) ; ( 3 ) education-only ( represent usual care , call Tools4CHANGE ) . In main trial , approximately half child also school take part We Run This City ( WRTC ) Marathon program , school-based fitness program administer YMCA , half school take part WRTC program . This study assess impact intervention main trial 's ( 1 ) primary outcome , Change Body Mass Index ( BMI ) . ( 2 ) secondary outcome include diet , physical activity , sedentary behavior , sleep , blood pressure , cardiovascular risk , body composition , fitness , quality life ( 3 ) mediator include : child 's self-efficacy , social support , motivation , family problem solve ability , system think , self-regulation ; ( 4 ) moderator include : socioeconomic status , demographic factor , environmental factor , personal psychosocial characteristic child parent .
